text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Assisted household" means one or more individuals who occupy a rental unit in an assisted project.
"Assisted project" means a property that qualifies under § 7-105 of this subtitle.

"Assisted unit" means a dwelling unit that is in an assisted project and is subject to regulatory requirements regarding:
the rent the owner may charge; or
the maximum annual income of the household occupying the unit.
"Designated household" means a household that qualifies under § 7-213 of this title.
"Notice of intent" means a notice of intent to take a protected action in accordance with Subtitle 2 of this title.
"Owner" means a person who holds legal title to an assisted project or any mortgagee in possession, receiver, trustee, or other person that may take a protected action.
"Owner's offer" means the written offer made by the owner to parties having a right of first purchase under § 7-204 of this title.

section.section: "Project-based § 8 rental assistance" means federal rental assistance under § 8 of the United States Housing Act of 1937, 42 U.S.C. § 1437f, to the owner or lender of a housing project under a new construction program, a substantial rehabilitation program, a loan management assistance program, or a property disposition program.
"Project-based § 8 rental assistance" does not include rental assistance made directly to a tenant under existing certificate or voucher programs.

text.section: "Protected action" means a sale, conveyance, transfer, prepayment, termination, failure to renew, or expiration under § 7-102(a) of this title.

"Tenant protection assistance" means payments to, and extensions of leases for, the occupant or former occupant of an assisted unit in connection with a protected action as required under § 7-212 of this title.
